info.title: Dropbox
info.description: The Dropbox API allows you to build the power of Dropbox directly into your app.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The byte offset of this chunk, relative to the beginning of the full file. The server will verify that this matches the offset it expects. If it does not, the server will return an error with the expected offset.

parameters.name: upload_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the in-progress upload on the server. If left blank, the server will create a new upload session.

400.description: Bad input parameter. Error message should indicate which one and why.

401.description: Bad or expired token. This can happen if the user or Dropbox revoked or expired an access token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

403.description: Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user wont help here.

404.description: File or folder not found at the specified path.

405.description: Request method not expected (generally should be GET or POST).

429.description: Your app is making too many requests and is being rate limited. 429s can trigger on a per-app or per-user basis.

503.description: If the response includes the Retry-After header, this means your OAuth 1.0 app is being rate limited. Otherwise, this indicates a transient server error, and your app should retry its request.

507.description: User is over Dropbox storage quota.

parameters.name: include_media_info
parameters.description: If true, the returned cursor will be encoded with include_media_info set to true for use with /delta.

parameters.name: path_prefix
parameters.description: If present, the returned cursor will be encoded with a path_prefix for the specified path for use with /delta.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The metadata returned will have its size field translated based on the given locale. For more information see above.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the new folder to create relative to root.

parameters.name: root
parameters.description: The root relative to which path is specified. Valid values are auto (recommended), sandbox, and dropbox.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: rev
parameters.description: The revision of the file to retrieve. This defaults to the most recent revision.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Use to specify language settings for user error messages and other language specific text. See the notes above for more information about supported locales.

400.description: Bad input parameter. Error message should indicate which one and why.

401.description: Bad or expired token. This can happen if the user or Dropbox revoked or expired an access token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

405.description: Request method not expected (generally should be GET or POST).

429.description: Your app is making too many requests and is being rate limited. 429s can trigger on a per-app or per-user basis.

507.description: User is over Dropbox storage quota.

parameters.name: file_limit
parameters.description: Default is 10,000 (max is 25,000). When listing a folder, the service wont report listings containing more than the specified amount of files and will instead respond with a 406 (Not Acceptable) status response.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Each call to /metadata on a folder will return a hash field, generated by hashing all of the metadata contained in that response. On later calls to /metadata, you should provide that value via this parameter so that if nothing has changed, the response will be a 304 (Not Modified) status code instead of the full, potentially very large, folder listing. This parameter is ignored if the specified path is associated with a file or if list=false.

parameters.name: include_deleted
parameters.description: Only applicable when list is set. If this parameter is set to true, then contents will include the metadata of deleted children. Note that the target of the metadata call is always returned even when it has been deleted (with is_deleted set to true) regardless of this flag.

parameters.name: include_media_info
parameters.description: If true, each file will include a photo_info dictionary for photos and a video_info dictionary for videos with additional media info. If the data isnt available yet, the string pending will be returned instead of a dictionary.

parameters.name: include_membership
parameters.description: If true, metadata for a shared folder will include a list of the members of the shared folder.Heads up: The include_membership parameter is part of the Shared Folder extensions in production beta. Please complete this form for access.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: The strings true and false are valid values. true is the default. If true, the folders metadata will include a contents field with a list of metadata entries for the contents of the folder. If false, the contents field will be omitted.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The metadata returned will have its size field translated based on the given locale. For more information see above.

parameters.name: rev
parameters.description: If you include a particular revision number, then only the metadata for that revision will be returned.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: If credentials are passed in POST parameters, this parameter should be present and should be the apps key (found in the App Console).

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: If credentials are passed in POST parameters, this parameter should be present and should be the apps secret.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code acquired by directing users to /oauth2/authorize?response_type=code.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: The grant type, which must be authorization_code.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Only used to validate that it matches the original /oauth2/authorize, not used to redirect again.

parameters.name: rev_limit
parameters.description: Default is 10. Max is 1,000. Up to this number of recent revisions will be returned.

parameters.name: file_limit
parameters.description: The maximum and default value is 1,000. No more than file_limit search results will be returned.

parameters.name: include_deleted
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to true, then files and folders that have been deleted will also be included in the search.

parameters.name: include_membership
parameters.description: If true, metadata for a shared folder will include a list of the members of the shared folder.Heads up: The include_membership is in production beta. Please complete this form for access.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The metadata returned will have its size field translated based on the given locale. For more information see above.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search string. This string is split (on spaces) into individual words. Files and folders will be returned if they contain all words in the search string.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: jpeg (default) or png. For images that are photos, jpeg should be preferred, while png is better for screenshots and digital art.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of the following values (default: s):valuedimensions (px)xs32x32s64x64m128x128l640x480xl1024x768
